result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin M. Gorski

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Justin M. Gorski
Current: 834 East Lincoln Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53207 United States  (Effective: 10-18-2022)
Prior: N5467 Plzak Lane, Deerbrook, WI 54424

Maintain absolute sobriety,.
No illegal use or possession of illegal substances or medications not prescribed by physician.
No presence in establishments with Class B Liquor License.
No contact with victim or victim's residence.
Continue to comply with directives from Langlade County DHSS.
No communication with victim except through Attorney under 940.47(4). 
Do not leave state of Wisconsin without permission from court.
Surrender passport to Langlade County Sherriff.
If bond posted, must live with Aunt and Uncle, Jane and Warren Gorski - 834 E Lincoln Ave Milwaukee, WI.
Only to be in Langlade County for purposes of court hearings, and will leave immediately after Court.

10:00 AM Room 203 Defendant Justin M. Gorski appeared by video, in custody at LCJ.  Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court for Justin M. Gorski.  Attorney Kelly L Hays appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Remarks by defense. Court reads letter from defendant family. Defendant's atty. requests current bond be modified to $2500, absolute sobriety, reside in Milwaukee, only allowed to be in Langlade county where transportation with aunt and uncle is needed for purposes of court. State notes victim wants to give input. Victim gives input. State objects to modification of bond. Final remarks by defense. Final remarks by court. Court grants modification of bond with conditions of maintain absolute sobriety, no illegal use or possession of illegal substances or medications not prescribed by physician, no presence in establishments with Class B Liquor License, no contact with victim or victims residence, continue to comply with directives from Langlade County DHSS, no communication with victim except through atty under 940.47(4), do not leave state of Wisconsin without permission from court, surrender passport to Langlade County Sherriff, if bond posted, must live with aunt and uncle, Jane and Warren Gorski - 834 E Lincoln Ave Milwaukee, WI. If released, only to be in Langlade county for purposes of court hearings, and will leave immediately after court. Court lowers bond to $5,000 cash.  Status conference December 5 @1100 AM.

Letter to Judge w Residential & Employment Confirmation
Routed to Judge's JA

to Dismiss Count 1 of the Criminal Complaint
  (Routed to JA for Judge)
Bail/bond hearing on October 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:38 PM Defendant Justin M. Gorski appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court for Justin M. Gorski.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom. Atty Laufenberg has received a copy of the criminal complaint and waives reading, will be filing bond motion and requests status conference, waives time limits. Def. is in agreeance and waives time limits. Court receives waiver of time limits.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
4:01 PM Defendant Justin M. Gorski appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews case history. Def. is waiting on a court appointed Atty. and has contacted the PD office. Def. does not qualify for a PD and needs to get court appointing atty form.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Maintain absolute sobriety. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances or any medications not prescribed by a physician. No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. No contact with victim or victim's residence. Comply with Langlade County Department of Social Services. No communication with victim except through an attorney under 940.47(4).

1:11 PM/Room 203. Defendant Justin M. Gorski appeared by video, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. State heard on bond, recommends $100,000 cash bond with conditions maintain absolute sobriety including no use or possession of alcohol, no illegal use or possession of controlled substances, banned from establishments with Class B liquor license, no contact with victim or residence, comply with Langlade County Social Services.  No contact order under 940.47(4). Victim makes statement. Def. makes statement. Remarks by the Court. The Court orders $100,000 cash bond with conditions. State makes clarification as to no contact order and requests order under 940.47 (4). The Court orders no communication with victim except through an attorney. Bond issue may be revisited at later time.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
